Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Greater amberjack piscidin (Ile-rich; UCLL1a; natural AMPs; fish, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: mainly in spleen and gut, the greater amberjack,Seriola dumerili

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (68%) toE. malabaricus piscidine 1. Mol Wt: 3014.623; GRAVY: 0.04; Mol Formula: C140H226N46O28;   20% His, ILe = 32%. Predicted to be helical. It belongs to group 3 piscidin with a conserved RRRH sequence motif.Activity: Synthetic peptide (>85% pure) was used in antibacterial assays. Inhibits E. coli NCIMB 12260, A. salmonicida MT423,  A. salmonicida MT1741, A. salmonicida MT1742, A. salmonicida MT004, V. anguillarum MT1741, V. anguillarum MT1742, L. garvieae MT2055 and MT2291, Y. ruckeri MT252, and P. damselae MT1415. 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Milne DJ, Fernández-Montero Á, Gundappa MK, Wang T, Acosta F, Torrecillas S, Montero D, Zou J, Sweetman J, Secombes CJ.2019
Literature Information.Title: An insight into piscidins: The discovery, modulation and bioactivity of greater amberjack, Seriola dumerili, piscidin
